body_html:
Hi,
Would it be possible to make the distortion functions applicable not only on the entire batch, but also with a different seed per batch element ? This would lead to batches that have both the original and distorted examples, hence more diversity.

Something like:
inputs = tf.map_fn(lambda item: tf.image.random_flip_left_right(item[1], seed=item[0]), enumerate(inputs))
although it doesn't work this way, as there's an enum-to-tensor conversion.

I was also thinking about computing the seed as a function of the image (e.g. sum of all pixels), but it doesn't work with seed as Tensor, only int.

body:
Hi,
Would it be possible to make the distortion functions applicable not only on the entire batch, but also with a different seed per batch element ? This would lead to batches that have both the original and distorted examples, hence more diversity.

Something like:
`inputs = tf.map_fn(lambda item: tf.image.random_flip_left_right(item[1], seed=item[0]), enumerate(inputs))`
although it doesn't work this way, as there's an enum-to-tensor conversion.

I was also thinking about computing the seed as a function of the image (e.g. sum of all pixels), but it doesn't work with seed as Tensor, only int.
